channel.title: Models
channel.description:
Okay so I literally fail at clients.
I have all 474 models cache packed into an idx file, everyone loaded. But I don't know how to load just one model I want to add via ints. Any ideas?
Thanks.

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

I Vain I:

You can decompress the idx file to see which model is which one, then add the ints for that specific model.

Never mind, I wrote a new loader for a model file. You didn’t understand, thanks anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]No, you only stated an IDX file. I can easily take random models from any revision and compress them into a data, and and index file.

Is it from the actual 474 cache or just 474 models?[/quote]

Models.

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

I Vain I:

Wait, is it the actual 474 cache, or just 474 models compressed for a 317 client?

I thought I stated its 474 models cache packed into idx1? Isn’t that clear enough or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

I Vain I:

You’re going to need to view the models to know which ints go to which model ID. I’m guessing you could reverse the model packer to extract them. Or use a cache extractor/editor?

I already have the ints, I just want to add it; they’re is no raw / model file. Because they’re isn’t a loader for single models.
All 474 models are loaded from idx1 file in the cache.

Read full topic
